file_content.text: Congratulations, Knight. I'll meet you on Coruscant.
Master Orgus... everyone... I've discovered a situation requiring further assistance.
Our suspicions about Coruscant were correct. The dark presence we have long sensed is strongest here.
I keep hearing about this dark presence, but I haven't sensed it.
I feel nothing.
Had you spent as much time in meditation as the Council, you might.
What could be worse than a fallen Jedi attacking us?
Then it wasn't Bengel Morr.
That's what we need to find out. The security of the entire Republic is at stake.
I've already defeated one dark presence today. Might as well go for two.
I'll deal with it, no problem.
This darkness blinded us to threats much closer to home. I advise great caution.
Something malignant works in the shadows of the capital. We must find it.
This situation calls for our very best. Master Orgus, you and your former pupil should join Master Kiwiiks on Coruscant.
Come to the Senate tower as soon as you can. Master Kiwiiks out.
No rest for us, my friend. Complete any unfinished business you have and take a shuttle to Coruscant.
I'll leave immediately, Master.
My work here is done.
No offense, but I've had enough of Tython.
I can't wait to leave here.
Looking forward to getting away, myself.
All I get is a pat on the back and a new mission? I just saved this temple.
What, no parade?
We'll build a bronzium statue of you--promise.
I need to wrap up some things before I go. Meet you on Coruscant.
Farewell. The Force will be with you--always.
The Flesh Raiders are still a threat, but without Bengel's leadership, they'll be scattered and ill-equipped.
This temple could've been devastated. The entire order is in your debt, Padawan.
The enemy found weaknesses in our security. We have to guard against another Coruscant.
Let's tighten our defenses.
Agreed--and now we have concerns beyond the Flesh Raiders.
We can't give the Flesh Raiders time to regroup.
We should go to war.
Going to war only guarantees more violence. It's better to tighten our defenses. Besides, we have threats closer to home.
I crafted my own lightsaber. I'm a Jedi Knight, now.
Don't call me Padawan.
The rank of Knight is only conferred by the Council--and we have a more pressing topic to discuss.
Recent developments in the Twi'lek settlement demand a response.
Their Matriarch, Ranna, betrayed me, and now we hear the Flesh Raiders killed her. The settlement is in chaos.
Their Matriarch betrayed me to Bengel, but she surrendered herself to us for judgment. Your doing, I understand. Good work.
The young Matriarch, Ranna, betrayed me to Bengel. She has since disappeared, and the settlement is in chaos.
Their Matriarch, Ranna, betrayed me to Bengel. Reports indicate she still leads the settlement.
You know the Twi'leks, Padawan. How do you recommend we proceed?
We created instability by refusing to help them. That has to change.
They need our support.
What happened to Master Orgus is almost unforgivable.
But if we do forgive--and work with them--it can only improve both our communities.
The Twi'leks need guidance. We should take charge of their settlement.
We should take control.
Jedi don't govern others. That kind of power is too easily abused.
We don't need to govern the Twi'leks--just keep a close eye on them. Be ready to intervene.
They're a danger we can't afford--and they don't belong here. I say we round them up and ship them anyplace else.
Force them off Tython.
Forced resettlement of the Twi'leks runs against everything we stand for. Containment is a better option.
At least we know they can't be trusted. We won't put them in a position to betray us again.
This young Jedi saved us all from a terrible threat by defeating an experienced Force user.
Although Bengel Morr's body hasn't been found, the fact remains this young Jedi saved us from his army.
This young Jedi captured a fallen member of our order and saved this temple from destruction.
I see no reason for her to remain a Padawan.
I see no reason why he should remain a Padawan.
Your final trial has been marred by dark events, but I can't argue with your accomplishments.
Your bravery, heroism and sacrifice show great depth of character. You represent our best hopes for the future.
You arrived on Tython a Padawan, but you leave a Knight of the Republic. May the Force be with you.
I promise to uphold every standard of the Jedi and Galactic Republic.
This is a great honor, Master.
I'm eager to do some good in the galaxy. Send me somewhere I can help out.
What's my next mission?
Plenty of trouble spots in the galaxy. We'll find one for you.
It's about time. No more "Padawan do this" and "Padawan go there."
Finally!
That's right. Now the real work begins.
T7 = requests permanent assignment to assist Jedi // T7 + Jedi = unstoppable
This little droid and I have been through a lot. We're a great team.
That's a fine idea.
Then I see no reason why you shouldn't stay together.
"Unstoppable" is a strong word, but you have your uses.
Let's not go that far.
Teeseven has served faithfully for many years. He'll serve you equally well. Request granted.
I don't need some machine underfoot.
No thanks.
T7 = requests upgraded servomotors // T7 = agile
It's good for young Jedi Knights to have a trustworthy assistant. Your request is granted, Teeseven.
After a few small upgrades, I think Teeseven will serve you well. Request granted.
We're getting a priority signal from Coruscant. It's Master Kiwiiks....
Padawan... I must have you to thank for being alive.
I defeated Bengel Morr, Master. He's dead.
Poor man. He was so lost.
I fought Bengel Morr, and he fell into the ravine. He's dead.
Force willing, we'll recover the poor man's body and give him a proper funeral.
I captured Bengel Morr, Master. He's resting quietly.
You've done a great thing. He deserves a second chance.
The horrors he witnessed on Coruscant broke him--destroyed the gentle Padawan I trained.
You, however, faced a challenge beyond any trial I could assign. There's nothing more I can teach you.
Jedi = big victory // T7 = congratulates Jedi
All that's left is for you to enter the Forge and construct your own lightsaber.
There's no substitute for the weapon you create yourself.
What is this place, Master?
Forge?
The first Jedi came here to construct their lightsabers millennia ago. It's strong in the Force.
Haven't I done enough work for one day?
Terrific--more chores.
Creating a lightsaber is more than work; you're building a connection to the Force.
Normally, we make Padawans gather materials themselves--but you've proven enough.
These are all the physical components--the rest will come from your mastery of the Force.
T7 = stay with Jedi + keep guard
I'll carry Bengel's body to the Jedi Temple. Meet me there when you're ready.
I'll return to the Jedi Temple and organize a search party for Bengel's body. Meet me there when you're ready.
I'll carry Bengel back to the Jedi Temple and get him help. Meet me there when you're ready.
The Flesh Raider camp's out of commission, Master--but they were all Force users. They killed a Jedi named Laotah.
His body is in these ruins. What should I do?
We'll reclaim our fallen later. Just got a distress call from the Twi'lek settlement. They spotted Bengel Morr!
Our forces are spread out dealing with the secret camps. We're the only ones who can handle this.
I'm on my way to the settlement. Meet me there!
One camp is in the ruins of Upper Kaleth. That patrol you fought earlier was based there. Now's your chance to finish them off.
Why spread our forces thin to hit all the camps at once?
We shouldn't split up.
If we only go after a few, the Flesh Raiders could warn the rest and regroup.
What if I run into your old Padawan?
Bengel Morr could be there.
If you see Bengel, retreat and contact me immediately.
You're asking a lot. When I become a Knight, I want a special lightsaber or something.
I deserve extra credit.
When this is over, we'll talk about your unhealthy need for recognition.
Be careful in those ruins. We haven't explored them all.
Contact me when your mission's complete. May the Force be with you.
Finally put the Flesh Raider base out of commission. How are things on your end?
Spoke to your old Padawan over the holo. He's doing all this so he can destroy the Sith.
Bengel Morr contacted me.
Then he's not Sith himself--good. If I can get to him, reason with him....
I let Ranna perform a family-bonding ritual with me. Her mother died, and I wanted to console her.
I disobeyed the Jedi Code.
A mistake born out of compassion is common for young Jedi. At least you had the good sense to admit the error.
Jedi don't form attachments because those bonds are hard to break. Now that's exactly what you must do.
I won't let my relationship with Ranna become a problem.
I understand, Master.
Glad to hear it. Let's get back to work.
Jedi are supposed to honor their promises, aren't they?
This feels wrong.
And that's why a good Jedi never promises anything she can't deliver. Regardless, we don't have time to debate this.
Don't worry. This won't be a problem.
[Lie] I understand.
Good, because we don't have time for distractions.
I know Jedi aren't allowed to form attachments, but... something happened with Ranna.
I disobeyed the Jedi Code.
I'm proud of you for admitting the mistake. A lesser Padawan would've kept it a secret.
Whatever feelings you have for that girl, bury them now. If you don't, they'll only bring you suffering.
I'm sorry I let you down, Master.
Please accept my apology.
You're not the first Jedi to seek comfort in a time of crisis. Just put it behind you.
Not every relationship ends badly. Why should I be afraid to care about someone?
I can't believe that.
Have you heard anything I've said? Just as well I'm getting you out of that settlement....
As far as I'm concerned, it was a one-time thing.
[Lie] I won't see her again.
Just make sure there aren't more "one-time things." Ranna won't be the last attractive woman you meet.
Good thing I returned to the settlement. Flesh Raiders tried to poison the crops, but I stopped them.
The Flesh Raiders struck back.
Poison? They're getting desperate.
Please tell me I'm getting out of this blasted Twi'lek settlement.
I'm bored out of my mind.
Be careful what you wish for.
At the Flesh Raider command base, I found coordinates to a number of secret camps--too many to send only Jedi Masters.
I can't enter that Flesh Raider base until you knock out their energy shield. May the Force be with you.
The man who attacked you when you first arrived? His lightsaber had a familiar aspect. This droid's holorecording confirmed my suspicions.
T7 = sorry for bringing bad news
The hooded figure in that recording is named Bengel Morr. He was my Padawan--but he never completed his training.
Bengel was in the Jedi Temple on Coruscant when the Sith destroyed it.
The Force was with him if he got out of there alive.
Somehow, he survived.
The temple was annihilated. Hundreds of Jedi died that day. We never recovered all the bodies.
He waited a long time to reveal himself.
That was years ago.
Still don't understand why he just disappeared. Doesn't make sense.
His face isn't visible in the holo. Maybe your mind's playing tricks on you?
You could be imagining things.
I know my Padawan's voice when I hear it. What I don't know is how--why--he changed.
Bengel was strong in the Force, and the most gentle being I've ever known.
For him to turn against the Jedi... he has to be stopped.
Apologies for keeping you waiting. Our people's Matriarch--my mother--is dying.
That's terrible news. Will you be alright?
I'm so sorry.
I didn't think the burden of leadership would feel so heavy.
I wasn't expecting to lead our people for many years.
You should be at her side.
Go to her.
You're kind, but my mother wants me here.
Mother said my work with you must come first.
We all have to go sometime.
I suppose Jedi don't let themselves feel sadness.
You have our sympathies, Ranna--but the enemy won't give us time for mourning. Please tell us what you've learned.
My scouts have identified a Flesh Raider command base in the mountains. It's protected by an energy shield.
The shield's power generator is hidden on a different mountain, in a well-guarded cave network.
That command base is probably coordinating all the attacks in the region. I need to get inside there.
You up for knocking out the power generator?
When have I ever let you down?
Always, Master.
First time for everything--not that I'm worried.
You'll need backup. Can't we send someone else to handle the power generator?
Let me go with you.
You've shown you can handle Flesh Raiders. We need you there.
I need to complete my training. Is this mission part of my final trials?
Is this one of my Jedi tests?
Please keep your mind in the present, Padawan.
Important secondary mission = perform high-level scan of enemy forces // Mountain paths = too dangerous for T7
Hmm. See if you can give the droid an opening to gather more intelligence.
T7 = give Jedi head start // Follow when path is clear
That energy shield is your top priority. Knock it out fast as you can.
Master Kiwiiks told me what you found in Kaleth--a Flesh Raider who used the Force.
She thought he was learning things from an old holocron. I wish that were true.
I'm here, Master. What is it?
I'm on my way back to the Twi'lek settlement. Meet me there soon as you can.
You left without explaining anything. What has you so worried?
Tell me what you found.
I'll explain when I see you.
I'm already on my way.
Understood.
I've been surviving the ruins of Kaleth. Thanks for asking.
I'm fine, by the way.
If I didn't think you could handle it, I wouldn't have sent you there.
Find me at the Matriarch's compound. Orgus out.
Travel safely out there. The Flesh Raiders are on the move.
Blast those Council meetings. I'd die of old age before my colleagues ran out of things to say.
I'd rather do something about problems than discuss them.
I prefer action to speeches.
Still, there are times when talking is exactly what's needed.
Have you always felt this way about your fellow Masters?
You don't like the Council?
Don't misunderstand--they're good people. I just prefer to get things done.
It seems talking is what they're best at.
They are long-winded.
Council members earn their seats after many victories and sacrifices. Respect that.
This situation has come at you fast. You're braving dangers many Jedi never face.
I wouldn't blame you for having questions. This may be the only time to ask them.
I'll make sense of things later. Let's find our enemy.
My questions can wait.
I know people who can help.
I get the impression you haven't had a Padawan for years. Why did you ask to train me?
Why did you choose me?
As Jedi, you learn to trust your instincts.
When I met you in that cave, my instincts told me that I was meant to train you.
I don't know why, or for what purpose, but the Living Force brought us together for a reason.
I look forward to learning from you.
I'm glad it did, Master.
I expect you have things to teach me, as well. Let's get to work.
You think the Force is alive? That it wants something from us?
The Living Force?
"Want" is too strong a word. Let's just say we'll accomplish more together than by ourselves.
I don't much care for mystical philosophy, but whatever floats your speeder.
If you say so.
Hmph. Anyway--to find our hidden enemy, we'll need allies.
I get the feeling you know more about this threat than you're telling me.
I think you're hiding things.
I have... a bad feeling about this. But that's all.
When I know more, I will tell you. Trust me.
I know you wouldn't keep anything from me without a good reason.
I do, Master.
I'm not keeping secrets--just avoiding careless rumor. We need real answers.
You're leaving me unprepared.
By then it could be too late.
The Force will guide us both through this--with a little help.
How can I trust you when you don't trust me?
That's a two-way street.
I do trust you. I'd just rather get real answers than stand around making wild guesses.
There's a group of Twi'lek Pilgrims on Tython. They've been fighting the Flesh Raiders for months.
The Republic asked us to deny those Twi'leks aid--they settled here illegally--but frankly, we need them.
How are they violating the law?
An illegal settlement?
When Tython was first rediscovered, the Twi'leks petitioned the Senate to settle here. Their claim was denied--too dangerous--but they came anyway.
Please tell me this isn't a diplomatic mission.
I'm hoping for some action.
The Twi'leks are in the thick of it. I suspect you'll have to fight your way to them.
The Republic shouldn't be telling the Jedi what to do.
The Republic is wrong.
Forgot how impressionable Padawans can be. Remember, Jedi exist to serve the Republic--even when we disagree.
The Twi'leks have a settlement in the mountains. That's your next stop.
Establish a base camp and speak to the Matriarch. Find out everything the Twi'leks know about Flesh Raiders.
I'm ready to get back out there--do some good.
I'll go right now.
Anything you can tell me about the Twi'lek leader?
Matriarch?
Word is she's not our biggest fan. You may have to convince her otherwise.
If the Twi'leks won't share what they know, how far can I push them?
And if they don't cooperate?
Don't push--bend. Show those people we're here to help.
I'll join you soon. May the Force be with you.
I searched the temple archives. This Force user leading the Flesh Raiders never received Jedi training.
Then the Sith have found us. Shouldn't we get ready for them?
Calm yourself, Padawan. We can't be certain of anything, yet.
But we've all sensed a growing darkness--perhaps it's finally revealed itself.
The enemy I faced wanted to destroy the Jedi Order. Can't get much darker than that.
There is darkness here.
Well, that brightened up the room....
Someone want to bring me up to speed?
What have I missed?
We're just having a nice end-of-the-world chat.
Your "growing darkness" just tried to kill me.
I'm proof of that.
See? It's not just me who's worried.
Everyone, this is the Padawan who saved our people in the training grounds.
This is Master Kiwiiks and her extremely vocal Padawan, Kira. The other Masters are transmitting from distant worlds.
It's unfortunate our numbers are scattered.
Indeed. The temple's safety is unexpectedly threatened. The Flesh Raiders were disorganized primitives before today.
They carry blasters and work like an army. We need to find out why.
Not anymore.
They didn't change overnight.
We clearly underestimated the natives.
Without the man organizing them, they're just mindless savages.
But their leader is dead.
I doubt it's that simple.
The man leading the Flesh Raiders probably wasn't acting alone.
Much of Tython remains unexplored, and we have few resources to spare.
I'll handle it--with the help of my new Padawan.
Orgus, you haven't taken a Padawan since Coruscant.
The Force is strong in her. Stronger than I've seen in decades.
The Force is strong in him. Stronger than I've seen in decades.
I can think of no finer Master to complete this Padawan's training.
I'll complete my final trials once we've dealt with the Flesh Raiders.
Training can wait.
That is what you should aspire to, Kira.
Me neither.
Don't get too excited. You're in for some hard work.
If I'm so special, shouldn't the leader of the Jedi train me?
I can--you.
My duties to the order come first--and don't underestimate Master Orgus.
You'll find supplies in my chambers downstairs. Go equip yourself. I'll meet you there.
Tython is full of dangers, even for Jedi. If you must go out, don't travel alone.
I'll take my lightsaber back, if you don't mind. Feel naked without it.
Go on. This won't take long.
A Flesh Raider had your weapon. I used it to defend myself.
I have yours, Master.
Thank you, Master.
